New Records: Shaheen Shah Afridi is now the fastest to 100 ODI wickets for quick bowlers
Shaheen Shah Afridi is the leading wicket-taker at this World Cup
Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi took 3 wickets in his first 2 overs
Litton Das fell with the softest of dismissals against a long hop from Iftikhar Ahmed
Shakib Al Hasan was cleaned up by Afridi with an unplayable reverse-swinging delivery
Bangladesh rebuilt, but the momentum had been sapped right out of the innings
Fakhar Zaman and Abdullah Shafique put up 128 for the first wicket
Mehidy did his bit to ensure the ignominy wasn't quite as severe, taking three wickets
Post-Match Reflections: The win, after four losses in a row, has lifted Pakistan to No. 5 on the points table and kept their faint hopes of a semi-final appearance alive
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win was set up by a commanding performance from Shaheen Shah Afridi
Fakhar Zaman, freshly recalled to the side, then turned in his best showing in months, a vintage 74-ball 81
Others: Pakistan won by 7 wickets with 105 balls remaining
